meanings.definition: A small, raised, red swelling on the skin, typically caused by an insect bite or allergic reaction.
meanings.sent1: After the mosquito bite, a wheal appeared on her arm.
meanings.sent2: She noticed a wheal on her leg after touching the plant.
meanings.sent3: The wheal on his cheek made him look like he had a tiny mountain.
meanings.sent4: The wheal on her skin was like a tiny volcano erupting.
meanings.sent5: The wheal on his arm glowed like a small red gem.

meanings.definition: A ridge or wall of earth or stone to protect a fortification.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers built a wheal around the castle to keep enemies out.
meanings.sent2: The ancient fort had a strong wheal surrounding it.
meanings.sent3: The wheal around the fort looked like a giant snake coiled around it.
meanings.sent4: The wheal of stones stood tall like a guardian of the castle.
meanings.sent5: The wheal of earth shielded the fort like a protective barrier.
